basics.title: Understanding Blood Donation
basics.whatIsBloodDonationContent: Blood donation is a voluntary procedure that can help save lives. There are several types of blood donation:

donationTypes.wholeDescription: The most common type of donation where we collect about a pint of whole blood.
donationTypes.plasmaDescription: Collects the liquid portion of blood that carries blood cells.
donationTypes.plateletsDescription: Collects platelets which help blood clot and are essential for cancer patients.

bloodTypes.title: Blood Types and Compatibility
bloodTypes.introduction: Understanding blood types is crucial for safe transfusions. There are 8 main blood types:

types.aPositive: A+: Can receive from A+, A-, O+, O-
types.aNegative: A-: Can receive from A-, O-
types.bPositive: B+: Can receive from B+, B-, O+, O-
types.bNegative: B-: Can receive from B-, O-
types.abNegative: AB-: Can receive from all negative types
types.oPositive: O+: Can receive from O+, O-

rhFactor.title: Rh Factor
rhFactor.description: The positive or negative sign after your blood type refers to the Rh factor. This is important for preventing complications during transfusions and pregnancy.

compatibility.title: Compatibility Chart
compatibility.description: Use this chart to understand which blood types are compatible for transfusions.

preparation.title: How to Prepare for Blood Donation

beforeDonation.title: Before Your Donation
beforeDonation.eat: Eat a healthy meal within 3 hours of donation
beforeDonation.iron: Eat iron-rich foods in the weeks before donation

dayOf.title: On Donation Day
dayOf.wear: Wear comfortable clothing with sleeves that roll up easily
dayOf.bring: Bring valid ID and list of medications
dayOf.schedule: Allow about an hour for the whole process

afterDonation.title: After Donation Care
afterDonation.bandage: Keep the bandage on for several hours

Welcome.title: Welcome to Blood Donors Community
Welcome.subtitle: Join our lifesaving mission to make blood donation accessible and efficient. Every drop counts in our journey to save lives together.

about.title: About Our Community
about.content: We are a dedicated network of volunteers, medical professionals, and community members working together to ensure a stable and safe blood supply. Since our establishment, we have helped thousands of patients through the generous contributions of our donors.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To create a sustainable and efficient blood donation ecosystem that connects donors with those in need, while promoting awareness about the importance of regular blood donation.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: To build a world where no life is lost due to blood shortage, fostering a community where blood donation becomes a regular part of people's lives.
